Those who are connected with our sanitariums should make every effort to encourage the patients to live an outdoor life, so far as it is possible for them to do so. Nature is the great physician that will heal them of all their maladies, both spiritual and physical. Everything that can be done should be done to give those who come to our sanitariums for treatment the opportunity of living as much as possible in the open air. The patients should 
                                                                           233
have the advantages that are given by natural surroundings. Nature is the great restorer of both soul and body.--MS. 43, 1902.
